## RetryStrategyConfig.retryableErrors property

List of error message patterns (strings or RegExp) that are retryable.

**Signature:**

```typescript
retryableErrors?: (string | RegExp)[];
```

## Remarks

- If undefined and `retryableErrorTypes` is also undefined: all errors are retried (default) - If specified: only errors with messages matching these patterns are retried - Strings are matched using `includes()`<!-- -->, RegExp patterns use `test()` - Combined with `retryableErrorTypes` using OR logic

## Example

```typescript
// Retry errors containing "timeout" or "connection"
retryableErrors: ["timeout", "connection"];

// Retry errors matching regex patterns (case-insensitive)
retryableErrors: [/timeout/i, /network.*failed/i];
```
